spirit:register.spirit:name: rx_ctlecal0_ctrl
spirit:register.spirit:description: CTLE VGA offset calibration 0 control register

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_ctlecal0_ctrl_15
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: This bit is intended to be for diagnostics purposes only. This calibration process is automatically activated internally by the power state machine. When using this bit, the user must wait until after the internally activated process completes.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_ctlecal0_ctrl_14
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: Three cmn_ref_clk cycles are required after the start of the calibration process to clear this signal.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_ctlecal0_ctrl_13
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: Due to the nature of the calibration process, it is not possible to determine if the analog responded or not for the lowest code of 4'b1001. The reason for this is, when sequencing to lower codes, the calibration function is looking for the analog response to transition from 1'b1 to 1'b0. If the lowest calibration code is the correct code, the analog will respond with 1'b1, and the algorithm can't sequence to a lower code to look for the transition from 1'b1 to 1'b0. Similarly, if the analog is not responding, it is not possible to sequence to a lower code to detect this. Therefore, even when the calibration function selects this calibration code as valid, this bit will be set.

spirit:register.spirit:name: rx_ctlecal0_ovrd
spirit:register.spirit:description: CTLE VGA offset calibration 0 override register

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_ctlecal0_ovrd_15
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: The value of this field must not be changed while the calibration function is running.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_ctlecal0_ovrd_5_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: The value of this field must not be changed while the calibration function is running.

spirit:register.spirit:name: rx_ctlecal0_tune
spirit:register.spirit:description: CTLE VGA offset calibration 0 tune register

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_ctlecal0_tune_5_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: This value is a twos complement value, so the calibrated code can be increased or decreased.

spirit:register.spirit:name: rx_ctlecal0_init_tmr
spirit:register.spirit:description: CTLE VGA offset calibration 0 initialization timer register

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_ctlecal0_init_tmr_11_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: This results in the minimum number of cmn_ref_clk clocks required to wait 1 uSec. Note: This should never be set to a value of less than 1.

spirit:register.spirit:name: rx_ctlecal0_iter_tmr
spirit:register.spirit:description: CTLE VGA offset calibration 0 iteration timer register

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_ctlecal0_iter_tmr_11_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: This results in the minimum number of cmn_ref_clk clocks required to wait 5 uSec. Note: This should never be set to a value of less than 3.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_ctlecal1_ctrl_14
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: Three cmn_ref_clk cycles are required after the start of the calibration process to clear this signal.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_ctlecal1_ctrl_13
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: Due to the nature of the calibration process, it is not possible to determine if the analog responded or not for the lowest code of 4'b1001. The reason for this is, when sequencing to lower codes, the calibration function is looking for the analog response to transition from 1'b1 to 1'b0. If the lowest calibration code is the correct code, the analog will respond with 1'b1, and the algorithm can't sequence to a lower code to look for the transition from 1'b1 to 1'b0. Similarly, if the analog is not responding, it is not possible to sequence to a lower code to detect this. Therefore, even when the calibration function selects this calibration code as valid, this bit will be set.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_ctlecal1_ovrd_15
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: The value of this field must not be changed while the calibration function is running.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_ctlecal1_ovrd_5_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: The value of this field must not be changed while the calibration function is running.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_ctlecal1_tune_5_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: This value is a twos complement value, so the calibrated code can be increased or decreased.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_ctlecal1_init_tmr_11_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: This results in the minimum number of cmn_ref_clk clocks required to wait 1 uSec. Note: This should never be set to a value of less than 1.

spirit:register.spirit:name: rx_slc_init_tmr
spirit:register.spirit:description: RX sampler latch calibration initialization timer value register

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_slc_init_tmr_15_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: This register should not be set to 16'h0000.

spirit:register.spirit:name: rx_slc_run_tmr
spirit:register.spirit:description: RX sampler latch calibration run timer value register

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_slc_run_tmr_15_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Cadence internal note: The run timer value was changed to such a much longer time to allow for longer averaging, because of concerns the analog team has with regards to thermal noise. Significant variations of calibration codes were observed during lab characterization. It was shown in simulations that this was likely due to lower noise frequencies. Extending the run time has been shown to address the issue.

spirit:register.spirit:description: RX sampler latch calibration diagnostic control register

spirit:field.spirit:description: CDRLF first order loop sigma delta update rate standard mode 3

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_cdrlf_cnfg0_20_16
spirit:field.spirit:description: CDRLF first order loop sigma delta update rate standard mode 2

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_cdrlf_cnfg0_12_8
spirit:field.spirit:description: CDRLF first order loop sigma delta update rate standard mode 1

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_cdrlf_cnfg0_4_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: CDRLF first order loop sigma delta update rate standard mode 0

spirit:register.spirit:name: rx_cdrlf_cnfg1
spirit:register.spirit:description: CDRLF configuration register 1

spirit:register.spirit:name: rx_cdrlf_cnfg2
spirit:register.spirit:description: CDRLF configuration register 2

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_cdrlf_cnfg2_20_16
spirit:field.spirit:description: CDRLF second order loop sigma delta update rate standard mode 2

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_cdrlf_cnfg2_12_8
spirit:field.spirit:description: CDRLF second order loop sigma delta update rate standard mode 1

spirit:register.spirit:name: rx_cdrlf_cnfg4
spirit:register.spirit:description: CDRLF configuration register 4

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_cdrlf_cnfg4_6_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: This field must never be set to a value less than 2 (6'b000010).

spirit:register.spirit:name: rx_cdrlf_cnfg5
spirit:register.spirit:description: Note: Writing this register will result in wait states, in order to allow the values to be propagated to and sampled in the analog.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_cdrlf_cnfg5_18
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note : This bit will be automatically cleared after the down request has been sent to the CDRLF IQ PI inter- face logic. The down request is generated by changing the state of the cdrlf_pi_down_in signal in the CDRLF.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_cdrlf_cnfg5_17
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note : This bit will be automatically cleared after the up request has been sent to the CDRLF IQ PI interface logic. The up request is generated by changing the state of the cdrlf_pi_up_in signal in the CDRLF.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_cdrlf_cnfg5_14
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note : This bit will be automatically cleared after the down request has been sent to the CDRLF PI inter- face logic.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_cdrlf_cnfg5_13
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note : This bit will be automatically cleared after the up request has been sent to the CDRLF PI interface logic.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_cdrlf_cnfg5_2
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: This signal is intended be for verification purposes only. It should be set to 1'b0 for normal operation.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_cdrlf_cnfg5_1
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: This signal is intended be for verification purposes only. It should be set to 1'b0 for normal operation.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_cdrlf_cnfg5_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: This signal is intended be for verification purposes only. It should be set to 1'b0 for normal operation.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_cdrlf_fpl_ctrl1_27_24
spirit:field.spirit:description: Fast phase lock timer trigger 3 state time value standard mode 0

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_cdrlf_fpl_ctrl1_19_16

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_cdrlf_fpl_ctrl1_10
spirit:field.spirit:description: CDRLF fast phase lock locked detected:

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_cdrlf_fpl_ctrl1_8
spirit:field.spirit:description: CDRLF fast phase lock enabled by signal detect

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_cdrlf_fpl_ctrl1_7_4
spirit:field.spirit:description: Fast phase lock timer accumulate state time value

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_cdrlf_fpl_ctrl1_3_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Fast phase lock timer delay state time value

spirit:register.spirit:name: rx_cdrlf_fpl_ctrl2
spirit:register.spirit:description: CDRLF fast phase lock control 2 register

spirit:register.spirit:name: rx_cdrlf_fpl_ctrl3
spirit:register.spirit:description: CDRLF fast phase lock control 3 register

spirit:register.spirit:name: rx_cdrlf_pi_php
spirit:register.spirit:description: Note: The information read in this register is retrieved from another clock domain. Reading this register will result in wait states, in order to allow the control and data to cross the clock domains and be stable such that it can be accurately read.

spirit:register.spirit:name: rx_cdrlf_2ol_gain
spirit:register.spirit:description: Note: The information read in this register is retrieved from another clock domain. Reading this register will result in wait states, in order to allow the control and data to cross the clock domains and be stable such that it can be accurately read.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_qcccal_ctrl_14
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: Three cmn_ref_clk cycles are required after the start of the calibration process to clear this signal.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_qcccal_ctrl_13
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: Due to the nature of the calibration process, it is not possible to determine if the analog responded or not for the lowest code of 4'b1001. The reason for this is, when sequencing to lower codes, the calibration function is looking for the analog response to transition from 1'b1 to 1'b0. If the lowest calibration code is the correct code, the analog will respond with 1'b1, and the algorithm can't sequence to a lower code to look for the transition from 1'b1 to 1'b0. Similarly, if the analog is not responding, it is not possible to sequence to a lower code to detect this. Therefore, even when the calibration function selects this calibration code as valid, this bit will be set.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_qcccal_tune_4_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: This value is a twos complement value, so the calibrated code can be increased or decreased.

spirit:register.spirit:name: rx_qcccal_init_tmr
spirit:register.spirit:description: QCC calibration initialization timer register

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_qcccal_init_tmr_8_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: This results in the minimum number of cmn_ref_clk clocks required to wait 1 uSec. Note: This should never be set to a value of less than 1.

spirit:register.spirit:name: rx_qcccal_iter_tmr
spirit:register.spirit:description: QCC calibration iteration timer register

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_qcccal_iter_tmr_8_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: This results in the minimum number of cmn_ref_clk clocks required to wait 5 uSec. Note: This should never be set to a value of less than 3.

spirit:register.spirit:name: xcvr_cmsmt_clk_freq_msmt_ctrl
spirit:register.spirit:description: Clock frequency measurement control register

spirit:field.spirit:name: xcvr_cmsmt_clk_freq_msmt_ctrl_15
spirit:field.spirit:description: Note: The values in the Test clock selection register and Reference clock timer value register must be set prior to activating this bit.

spirit:register.spirit:name: xcvr_cmsmt_test_clk_sel
spirit:register.spirit:description: Test clock selection register

spirit:register.spirit:name: xcvr_cmsmt_ref_clk_tmr_value
spirit:register.spirit:description: Reference clock timer value register

spirit:field.spirit:name: xcvr_cmsmt_ref_clk_tmr_value_15_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: clock cycles. This value minus 1 is loaded into the reference clock timer. A value of 0 for this field is not valid when running this function.

spirit:register.spirit:name: xcvr_cmsmt_test_clk_cnt_value
spirit:register.spirit:description: Test clock counter value register

spirit:field.spirit:name: xcvr_cmsmt_test_clk_cnt_value_15_0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Test clock counter value: When the test clock measurement process is complete, the value in this field specifies the number of test clock cycles that were counted in the time specified by the reference clock timer value. This field is only valid while the test clock measurement done bit in the Clock frequency measurement control register is active.

spirit:register.spirit:name: rx_diag_xcvr_rate_sel
spirit:register.spirit:description: Reserved
